page.title: 16SHEEP SHEARING
page.content: I live on a{farm}near{Garforth.}There is always much to do, like repairing machinery or getting the fields ready. My father employs three men. We keep{ {sheep and cows.}We keep the cows for their meat not their milk. The sheep we use for{wool and meat.}When the sheep are ready for{shearing}between July and September we hire extra men, who are expert shearers. They take hold of the sheep and then with a machine with a lot of cutting blades the wool is cut off. When the wool, the fleece, is removed it is rolled up and put into a bag. The sheep are then dipped into disinfected water to kill off any bugs which remain on their skin. This has to be done by{law.}
